page.title: 04TREES AND THEIR USES
page.content: {The Paddockhurst}Estate forest consists of hardwood and softwood trees.The hardwoods are{oak,beech,ash {some birches}and only{2 elms.}The softwoods are{scotch pine, larch, {douglas fir,western hemlock}and{grand {fir.}1724 trees are planted per acre spaced 5 foot apart. The coniferous trees are left for about{6 years before they are thinned.When they are fully grown they are felled then taken to the sawmill to be made into gates, furniture fencing, brooms and paintbrush handles. Hardwoods take 150 years to grow Softwoods only take 60 years. Paddockhurst Estate own 6 tractors, 12 chainsaws, 4 trailers a rackbench and a landrover.In the sawmill (just to the E.of block) they have a circular plate saw which is a 100 years old.Outside there is a shed used for storing and drying.
